derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (as an adjective): from late Latin subalternus, from Latin sub- 'next below' + alternus 'every other'

entry.def: A subaltern is any commissioned officer in the army below the rank of captain.

means.word_mean: 1. a British commissioned army officer below the rank of captain

auth_sentence.content: In the trenches a subaltern's business was rather general than particular.
